text: Is anyone following the GameStonk saga?

text: it's already the best thing of 2021

attachments.fallback: [January 27th, 2021 1:45 PM] matt.brzezinski: From the other day talking about the $GME hold. This mad lads not letting leaving.
attachments.text: From the other day talking about the $GME hold. This mad lads not letting leaving.

elements.text: there's a small thread a few msgs up

text: Melvin Cap’s positions expire on Friday from what I’ve read, so people are just holding on until the weekend to hurt them

elements.text: Melvin Cap’s positions expire on Friday from what I’ve read, so people are just holding on until the weekend to hurt them

text:
this story is so unreal :smile: But besides the somewhat good initiative it's kinda hard to see things like:
> A friend of a friend of mine sold his apartment and went all in on GME yesterday

elements.text: this story is so unreal
But besides the somewhat good initiative it's kinda hard to see things like:
A friend of a friend of mine sold his apartment and went all in on GME yesterday
Yeah... don't sell your apartment

text: I guess these people would either buy GME or Bitcoin nowadays :man-shrugging:

elements.text: I guess these people would either buy GME or Bitcoin nowadays

text: Buying stocks or Bitcoin is fine, as long as you don't _ever_ rely on that ROI as a means of surviving the next few months/years. It's best to consider the money gone the second you bought the stock. It's always been a gamble and always will be.

elements.text: Buying stocks or Bitcoin is fine, as long as you don't
ever
rely on that ROI as a means of surviving the next few months/years. It's best to consider the money gone the second you bought the stock. It's always been a gamble and always will be.

text: Don't bet your livelihood on such a volatile thing.

elements.text: Don't bet your livelihood on such a volatile thing.

text: Some people were saying they would happily lose $10 to watch Melvin Capital and other short sellers lose billions

elements.text: Some people were saying they would happily lose $10 to watch Melvin Capital and other short sellers lose billions

text: I find it actually scary that some people recklessly think the economy is a game, and post memes about them "trolling" the market, when at the other end, real people's jobs are at stake. It's a mark of a sick society we accidentally built.

elements.text: I find it actually scary that some people recklessly think the economy is a game, and post memes about them "trolling" the market, when at the other end, real people's jobs are at stake. It's a mark of a sick society we accidentally built.

text: You really think that some redditors are the major problem when it comes down to "trolling" the market?

elements.text: You really think that some redditors are the major problem when it comes down to "trolling" the market?

text: I think he meant the hedgefunds

elements.text: I think he meant the hedgefunds

text: Because it’s the shortsellers that were trying to make GameStop and AMC go bankrupt, which is where the jobs are at stake

elements.text: Because it’s the shortsellers that were trying to make GameStop and AMC go bankrupt, which is where the jobs are at stake

text: It doesn't matter to me if it's redditors or anyone else who behave that way, but I do hope that most investors are not coked up Wolf of Wallstreet psychopaths. I know a ~hedgefund~ venture capital fund manager, and he is empathic and trustworthy, and takes his job seriously. These redditors don't seem like that to me.

elements.text: It doesn't matter to me if it's redditors or anyone else who behave that way, but I do hope that most investors are not coked up Wolf of Wallstreet psychopaths. I know a
hedgefund
venture capital fund manager, and he is empathic and trustworthy, and takes his job seriously. These redditors don't seem like that to me.

text: Ye but nobody cares if hedgefund managers do that on a *daily basis*. All they did is playing the game according to the rules.

elements.text: Ye but nobody cares if hedgefund managers do that on a
daily basis
. All they did is playing the game according to the rules.
